subject: EMERGENCY AIR COMPRESSOR
termsAndConditions: ACCOUNTING AND FISCAL INFORMATION 1) How to address the invoice: Costa Crociere S.p.a Piazza Piccapietra 48 - 16121 GENOVA (ITALY) C.F. e P. IVA: IT 02545900108 Tel.: +39 010 54831 It won’t be possible to process the invoice if not addressed as per above. PLEASE ALWAYS REFERENCE OUR P.O. NUMBER ON YOUR INVOICES. Please note that the supply is not subject to VAT pursuant to the article of the local VAT law applicable for supplies to ocean going ships invoiced to the shipowner. (pls see the VAT exemption declaration attached) View and download VAT EXEMPTION LETTER 2025 View and download ACCOUNTING AND FISCAL INFORMATION INSTRUCTIONS OF DELIVERY All deliveries to our warehouses or alongside the ship must follow the delivery instructions below:      1.      Please confirm the delivery date within 3 working days after receipt of the purchase order by confirming it via your ShipServ Trade account on shipserv.com      2.      In accordance with weights and dimensions, all deliveries must be packed properly for safe handling, storage, and transport.               •   All deliveries must be palletized, except for small deliveries/parcel deliveries:                    •     All packages shall be placed on Euro pallets.                    •     Max. pallet height and weight: 1,80m and 1000 kg                    •     For non-standard size parts, please contact our warehouse in advance to book a time slot and any specific delivery instructions.      3.      Please identify package/s (readable from outside), with Name of Ship and PO Number. All delivery documents can be easily removed from the outside.      4.      Any invoice must point out the presence of customs documents (EXA; T1; T2; E-AD), highlighting the number of the customs document.      5.      All deliveries must be separated by Ship.      6.      All delivery notes must contain single and total net/gross weights of the goods and the corresponding customs codes and country of origin.      7.      If the delivery of a single PO is composed of several packages, each one of those must be marked with 1/3, 2/3 etc. and the total number of packages must be mentioned in the delivery note.      8.      Whenever required for marine equipment as per EU Regulation 2017/306, please provide us with the MED (Marine Equipment Directive) Certificate.      9.      In the event of delivery of any controlled temperature goods, the related temperature requirement must be highlighted on the invoice and packing list.      10.   ADR  /  IMO information – if you are sending dangerous products, the goods need to arrive in a proper packaging, matching the rules of ADR  /  IMO /  IATA (depending how the goods shall be further transported). Packages containing                dangerous goods must be clearly labeled as such from the outside in accordance with the statutory regulations (ADR  /  IMO /  IATA). UN number, class, weight, and quantity of dangerous goods must be specified on the delivery note. The                goods must always be accompanied by the relevant MSDS. The MSDS must have the 16-sections format and must be in ENGLISH language. FOR DELIVERIES TO AIDA WAREHOUSE – BASTE & LANGE GMBH      11.   Each delivery must be accompanied by a delivery note and packing list.                Pre-alert must be sent to deliverynotes.aida@bastelange.com. FOR DELIVERIES TO COSTA WAREHOUSE – SEDISP SRL / ASBORNO SRL      12.   Each delivery must be accompanied by three (3) copies of the invoice. One (1) copy inside and two (2) copies outside.      13.   The invoice must state if it must be registered in the portal INTRASTAT CESSION (intracommunity cession register). FOR DELIVERIES ALONGSIDE SHIP      14.   The Port Agent involved must be informed and will give specific instructions about physical delivery and customs procedures.                Please contact the technical purchaser. For further details, please contact the technical purchaser to obtain our Logistic General Terms of Delivery (P3.02.02 IO02).
